body:
We're doing because various static analysis tools don't support reading dependencies from `setup.py`. They fail to detect them.

This is also preparation for pinning the version numbers of dependencies when we do the release. We're going to make so that in every released version all the dependencies for each plugin are pinned to a given version with `==` so that new versions which might break our compatibility are never installed for end users.

The next thing towards pinning is that we need to get the list of installed dependencies and their version for each plugin.

We should probably install `pipdeptree` in the CI, then after installing the plugin run `pipdeptree` to dump the list of installed deps with their versions to the CI output. We can then take the last good CI run before release and copy paste the version in the `requirements.txt` files.
Is it okay if I work on this?

@SGeetansh, Go ahead and let us know if you need any help! Try following the first comment for one plugin and then move on to the others. A good starting point would be any of the [model](https://github.com/intel/dffml/tree/master/model) plugins :)

@yashlamba @pdxjohnny 
How should I deal with this? Should I just move it to setup_common.py just like every other module?

https://github.com/intel/dffml/blob/6405f996d77df5ff749f9d5fa287fe7b08f528c5/model/autosklearn/setup.py#L12

Or should I add the script like this?
```python
REQUIREMENTS_TXT_PATH = Path(SELF_PATH, "requirements.txt")
if REQUIREMENTS_TXT_PATH.is_file():
    common.KWARGS["install_requires"] += list(
        map(lambda i: i.strip(), REQUIREMENTS_TXT_PATH.read_text().split("\n"))
    )
```
@SGeetansh any progress on this? Let us know if you get stuck or are no longer working on it
@pdxjohnny Really sorry for the delay. Got super busy with a college project.

issue.title: plugins: Added requirements.txt for each plugin

repository.name: dffml
repository.description: The easiest way to use Machine Learning. Mix and match underlying ML libraries and data set sources. Generate new datasets or modify existing ones with ease.
